context/4: So I drove them around until, all of a sudden, one of them says:
context/5: They wanted to go to a certain place in Beverly Hills, only they didn't know the address.
context/6: A couple of ladies I picked up on Sunset.
context/8: Well, Mr. Keddie, I notice that trip number 984 on your sheet is one which you have marked the destination to be Whittier and Wilshire.
context/9: I'm sorry, Your Honour, of course.

context: Had you ever seen Mr. Davenport before you were called in?
response: I don't understand.
context/0: I live just around the corner.
context/2: Are you the only doctor in the neighbourhood?
context/3: He said one of his guests was ill.
context/4: The owner of the Vista Motel.
context/7: Dr. Renault, when was the first time you were called in to treat Mr. Davenport?
context/8: You're still under oath.
context/9: You were sworn in yesterday, sir.

response: Time, gentleman.
context/0: Come on now, Sergeant, we're talking about progress and you can't report anything because you haven't made any.
context/1: Then the criminal would know what we're doing, too, wouldn't he?
context/2: Now, look here, you can't expect us to tell you every move we make, you know.
context/4: And you must confess, you haven't given me very much to turn in so far.
context/5: I just have to turn in a story each day.
context/6: No good to complain to me about it.
context/8: These things can't be done overnight, you know.
context/9: After all, we've only had four days.
